name: Pictionary
description: Pictionary is a charades-inspired word-guessing game. Players try to identify specific words from their partners' drawings.
equipment: Pictionary board game set (or a whiteboard/paper, markers/pens, and a list of words)
basicRules: One player from a team is chosen to be the first 'picturist'. The picturist draws a card with a word on it and has to draw clues for that word.
The picturist cannot use letters, numbers, or verbal cues.
Their team has a limited amount of time (usually one minute) to guess the word.
If the team guesses the word correctly, they get to roll a die and move their token on the game board.
The first team to reach the final space on the board and correctly guess a final word wins the game.
tips: Don't try to draw a masterpiece. Simple drawings are often more effective.
Think of common symbols and icons that can represent ideas.
Break down complex words into smaller, drawable parts.
